LanguageData.Plant_Dandelion.label: dandelions
LanguageData.Plant_Dandelion.description: A tiny yellow flower which grows in large clusters. Though it is often considered a weed, dandelions in bloom are quite beautiful.
LanguageData.Plant_Astragalus.label: astragalus
LanguageData.Plant_Astragalus.description: A small perennial wildflower that grows in alpine climates.
LanguageData.Plant_Moss.label: moss
LanguageData.Plant_Moss.description: Wild moss that grows in clumps in areas of low light and cool temperatures. Moss takes a long time to grow, but is very frost-resistant.
LanguageData.Plant_Raspberry.label: raspberry bush
LanguageData.Plant_Raspberry.description: A bushy wild plant which yields delicious red berries. Berries can be cooked, but they're also good to eat even when raw.
LanguageData.Plant_TreeOak.label: oak tree
LanguageData.Plant_TreeOak.description: A hardwood tree. Oaks take a long time to grow, but their wood is so strong that 'oak' is used as a metaphor for strength across many cultures.
LanguageData.Plant_TreePoplar.label: poplar tree
LanguageData.Plant_TreePoplar.description: A softwood tree that grows very fast. Unfortunately, its wood is weak and so it yields less useful material than hardwood trees.
LanguageData.Plant_TreePine.label: pine tree
LanguageData.Plant_TreePine.description: A large conifer covered with prickly pine cones. It grows in a distinctive conical shape.
LanguageData.Plant_TreeBirch.label: birch tree
LanguageData.Plant_TreeBirch.description: A temperate-biome tree known for its thin, white, paper-like bark.
